The movie follows the story of Bruce Wayne who is a private detective hired by his father, Thomas Wayne, after he dies in an attempt to save someone else's life. Bruce Wayne becomes obsessed with finding out who killed his father and why they did it.

In order to find answers, Bruce Wayne decides to become a superhero. He decides to create a costume that will allow him to move freely and to have access to the tools that he needs in order to fight crime.

After creating his costume, Bruce Wayne begins testing his costume to make sure that it works as intended. He also begins training himself in order to be able to fight crime once he becomes a superhero.

After completing his training, Bruce Wayne begins using his skills and abilities in order to fight crime once he becomes a superhero.

Based on your preferences and the information provided, I would recommend the movie "Batman Begins".

This movie tells the story of Bruce Wayne (played by Christian Bale)) who is orphaned at a young age. He grows up in Gotham City, where he discovers that criminals are able to operate freely in his city.

He then decides to dedicate himself to fighting crime and helping those in need in his city. He sets out on a journey to uncover the truth behind the rise of crime in his city.

The movie stars Christian Bale as Bruce Wayne, Liam Neeson as Lucius Bane, Michael Caine as Alfred Pennyworth, Gary Oldman as District Attorney Harvey Dent, and Rachel Weisz as Dr. Elektra Neve, among others.

The movie is directed by Christopher Nolan and produced by Legendary Pictures along with Nolan's production company, Syncopation.

The movie received positive reviews from critics and audiences alike upon its release in 2005.

In summary, based on your preferences for movies primarily in Korean and a focus on critical, artistic, and surefire commercial successes, I would recommend the movie "Batman Begins".

conversation.text:
I would recommend Her to someone who is looking for a romantic comedy with unique characters and storylines.

Her follows the story of two people, Alice (Scarlett Johansson) and Bob (Matt Letscher), who fall in love while they are both living in New York City, United States.

Their relationship faces challenges due to their different backgrounds and experiences. Alice is from a wealthy family and has grown up in privilege. Bob, on the other hand, comes from a lower socio-economic status and has faced many challenges throughout his life.
Despite these differences, Alice and Bob fall deeply in love with each other. They face numerous challenges throughout their relationship, including issues related to financial stability, cultural compatibility, and conflict resolution.
Throughout their relationship, Alice and Bob work together to overcome these challenges. Despite facing numerous challenges throughout their relationship, Alice and Bob ultimately succeed in building a strong and loving relationship with each other.
